oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Para-selective butylation of phenol over silicoaluminophosphate molecular sieve SAPO-11 catalyst
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SUBRAMANIAN, S
MITRA, A
SATYANARAYANA, CVV
CHAKRABARTY, DK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: crystalline inorganic solids
alkylation
methanol
zeolite
toluene
al
si
silicoaluminophosphate
sapo-11
butylation of phenol
para-selectivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alkylation of phenol with t-butanol in the vapour phase on SAPO-11 catalyst has been studied. The main products are 4-t-butylphenol, 2-t-butylphenol and 2,4-di-t-butylphenol, the last of these is the product of further alkylation of the 2-t-butylphenol. 2-t-butylphenol easily isomerises to 4-t-butylphenol whereas the reverse reaction is not significant. Separate Studies have shown that both butylphenols undergo easy dealkylation. The results of acid site poisoning by adsorption of bases as well as by sililation suggest that the reaction takes place essentially inside the zeolite pores.
